result.name: nematode-assemblages-from-lab-based-disturbance-experiments-using-samples-from-the-exe-and-1996
result.notes:
Data consists of presense data of nematode worms, from both sand and mud 
habiatats, in the form of count data. Bulk sediment samples were collected 
from both the Exe estuary and the Lynher estuary between February and May 
1996. This data is the result of labatory experiments on physical disurbance 
and details the counts of different nematode species of samples following 
disturbance and various lengths of recovery time. The Read Me file contains 
further information on the experiments conducted on each microcosm.

organization.name: marine-environmental-data-information-network

organization.description: MEDIN is a partnership of UK organisations committed to improving access to marine data. Our partners are both public and private sector.

result.title: Nematode assemblages from lab-based disturbance experiments using samples from the Exe and Lynher estuaries, February to May 1996
